name: Misc-dev
tagline: An undefined collection of classical texts and resources in TEI or EpiDoc formats.
body:
#Welcome to misc-dev!

##About
This repository contains miscellaneous classical texts encoded in [TEI P5](http://www.tei-c.org/Guidelines/P5/) or [EpiDoc](http://sourceforge.net/p/epidoc/wiki/Home/) formats. The files are encoded by the _Open Greek and Latin_ [research team](http://www.dh.uni-leipzig.de/wo/projects/open-greek-and-latin-project/) (researchers and student assistants).
While adequate, more can and should be done to improve the XML (the -dev(elopment) suffix indicates the repository is open to improvement).

##Contents
###Lexica
* Karl Ernst Georges (1910) _Kleines deutsch-lateinisches Handw√∂rterbuch_. Hannover und Leipzig: Hahnsche Buchhandlung.
 * [Part 1](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/Georges_Handwoerterbuch_1910_PART1.xml)
 * [Part 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/Georges_Handwoerterbuch_1910_PART2.xml)
 * [Part 3](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/Georges_Handwoerterbuch_1910_PART3.xml)

###Editions with facing translation
Each file contains both the source text and the facing translation. These, however, don't always appear in sequence: some files display the entire source text at the top and the translation at the bottom (albeit with page references), whilst others follow the edition layout (source text-translation, source text-translation, and so on). File issues, if any, are documented as sub-bullets.

####Latin
* Caesar, _[De Bello Alexandrino, De Bello Africo, De Bello Hispaniensi](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/caesar_1955.xml)_, with an English translation by A.G. Way (1955) London: William Heinemann; Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press.
* Cicero, _[De Officiis](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/ciceroDeOfficiis.xml)_, with an English translation by Walter Miller (1928) London: William Heinemann; Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press.
* Cicero, _[De Oratore](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/deOratore_1967.xml)_, with an English translation by E.W. Sutton (1967) London: William Heinemann; Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press.
* Cicero, _[Ad C. Herennium de ratione dicendi](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/adHerennium_1964.xml)_ (_Rhetorica ad Herennium_), with an English translation by Harry Caplan (1964) London: William Heinemann; Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press.
* Jerome, _[Epistulae, Vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/hieronymusEpistulae_2.xml)_. _Corpus Scriptorum Ecclesiasticorum Latinorum_. [See also: [CSEL](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/csel-dev/blob/master/CSEL55.xml)].
* _[Plautus, Vol. 4](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/plautus_4.xml)_, with an English translation by Paul Nixon (1980) London: William Heinemann; Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press. 
* _[Plautus, Vol. 5](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/plautus_5.xml)_, with an English translation by Paul Nixon (1952) London: William Heinemann; Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press. 
* [_Suetonius II_](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/suetonius_02_1959.xml), with an English translation by John Carew Rolfe (1959) London: William Heinemann; Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press.  

###Fragmentary Texts
####Ancient Greek
* _[Comicorum Atticorum Fragmenta, Vol. 2](https://github.com/OpenGreekAndLatin/misc-dev/blob/master/comicorumAtticorum_2.xml)_ (1884) ed. Theodor Kock. Lipsiae: In Aedibis B.G. Teubneri.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
